text: The book of the genealogy of Jesus Christ, the Son of David, the son of Abraham:
speaker: Narrator

text:
Abraham was the father of Isaac,
Isaac the father of Jacob,
and Jacob the father of Judah and his brothers.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Judah was the father of Perez and Zerah by Tamar,
Perez the father of Hezron,
and Hezron the father of Ram.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Ram was the father of Amminadab,
Amminadab the father of Nahshon,
and Nahshon the father of Salmon.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Salmon was the father of Boaz by Rahab,
Boaz the father of Obed by Ruth,
and Obed the father of Jesse.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Jesse was the father of David the king.
David the king was the father of Solomon, by her who had been the wife of Uriah.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Solomon was the father of Rehoboam,
Rehoboam the father of Abijah,
and Abijah the father of Asa.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Asa was the father of Jehoshaphat,
Jehoshaphat the father of Joram,
and Joram the father of Uzziah.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Uzziah was the father of Jotham,
Jotham the father of Ahaz,
and Ahaz the father of Hezekiah.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Hezekiah was the father of Manasseh,
Manasseh the father of Amon,
and Amon the father of Josiah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Josiah was the father of Jeconiah and his brothers about the time they were exiled to Babylon.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And after they were brought to Babylon,
Jeconiah was the father of Shealtiel,
and Shealtiel the father of Zerubbabel.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Zerubbabel was the father of Abiud,
Abiud the father of Eliakim,
and Eliakim the father of Azor.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Azor was the father of Zadok,
Zadok the father of Akim,
and Akim the father of Eliud.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Eliud was the father of Eleazar,
Eleazar the father of Matthan,
and Matthan the father of Jacob.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jacob was the father of Joseph, the husband of Mary, of whom was born Jesus, who is called Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: So all the generations from Abraham to David are fourteen generations, from David until the exile to Babylon are fourteen generations, and from the exile in Babylon to Christ are fourteen generations.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the birth of Jesus Christ happened this way: After His mother Mary was engaged to Joseph, before they came together, she was found with child by the Holy Spirit.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Joseph her husband, being a just man and not willing to make her a public example, had in mind to divorce her privately.
speaker: Narrator

text: But while he thought on these things, the angel of the Lord appeared to him in a dream saying, “Joseph, son of David, do not be afraid to take Mary as your wife, for He who is conceived in her is of the Holy Spirit.
speaker: Narrator

text: She will bear a Son, and you shall call His name JESUS, for He will save His people from their sins.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Now all this occurred to fulfill what the Lord had spoken through the prophet, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “A virgin shall be with child, and will bear a Son, and they shall call His name Immanuel,” which is interpreted, “God with us.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Joseph, being awakened from sleep, did as the angel of the Lord had commanded him, and remained with his wife,
speaker: Narrator

text: and did not know her until she had given birth to her firstborn Son. And he called His name JESUS.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now after Jesus was born in Bethlehem of Judea in the days of Herod the king, wise men came from the east to Jerusalem,
speaker: Narrator

text: saying, “Where is He who was born King of the Jews? For we have seen His star in the east and have come to worship Him.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When Herod the king heard these things, he was troubled, and all Jerusalem with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when he had gathered all the chief priests and scribes of the people together, he inquired of them where Christ should be born.
speaker: Narrator

text: They told him, “In Bethlehem of Judea, for this is what the prophet wrote:
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text: Then Herod, when he had privately called the wise men, carefully inquired of them what time the star appeared.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he sent them to Bethlehem and said, “Go and search diligently for the young Child, and when you have found Him, bring me word again, so that I may come and worship Him also.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When they heard the king, they departed. And the star which they saw in the east went before them until it came and stood over where the young Child was.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they saw the star, they rejoiced with great excitement.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when they came into the house, they saw the young Child with Mary, His mother, and fell down and worshipped Him. And when they had opened their treasures, they presented gifts to Him: gold, frankincense, and myrrh.
speaker: Narrator

text: But being warned in a dream that they should not return to Herod, they returned to their own country by another route.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now when they departed, the angel of the Lord appeared to Joseph in a dream, saying, “Arise, take the young Child and His mother, and escape to Egypt, and stay there until I bring you word. For Herod will seek the young Child to kill Him.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When he rose, he took the young Child and His mother by night, and departed into Egypt,
speaker: Narrator

text: and remained there until the death of Herod, to fulfill what the Lord had spoken through the prophet, “Out of Egypt I have called My Son.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Herod, when he saw that he had been tricked by the wise men, was utterly furious and sent forth and killed all the male children who were in Bethlehem and the surrounding region, from two years old and under, based on the time which he had diligently inquired of the wise men.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then was fulfilled what was spoken by Jeremiah the prophet:
speaker: Narrator

text:
“In Ramah a voice was heard,
    grieving and weeping and great mourning,
Rachel weeping for her children,
    and she would not be comforted,
because they are no more.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But when Herod was dead, an angel of the Lord appeared in a dream to Joseph in Egypt,
speaker: Narrator

text: saying, “Arise, take the young Child and His mother, and go into the land of Israel, for those who sought the young Child’s life are dead.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And he rose, took the young Child and His mother, and came into the land of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when he heard that Archelaus reigned in Judea instead of his father Herod, he was afraid to go there. Nevertheless, being warned by God in a dream, he withdrew to the region of Galilee.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he went and lived in a city called Nazareth, that what was spoken by the prophets might be fulfilled, “He shall be called a Nazarene.”
speaker: Narrator

text: In those days John the Baptist came, preaching in the wilderness of Judea,
speaker: Narrator

text: and saying, “Repent, for the kingdom of heaven is at hand.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
For this is he who was spoken of by the prophet Isaiah, saying:
“The voice of one crying in the wilderness:
‘Prepare the way of the Lord;
    make His paths straight.’ ”
speaker: Narrator

text: This same John had clothing made of camel’s hair, a leather belt around his waist, and his food was locusts and wild honey.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jerusalem, and all Judea, and all the region around the Jordan went out to him,
speaker: Narrator

text: and were baptized by him in the Jordan, confessing their sins.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when he saw many of the Pharisees and Sadducees come to his baptism, he said to them, “O generation of vipers, who has warned you to escape from the wrath to come?
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore, bear fruit worthy of repentance,
speaker: Narrator

text: and do not think to say within yourselves, ‘We have Abraham as our father,’ for I say to you that God is able from these stones to raise up children for Abraham.
speaker: Narrator

text: Even now the axe is put to the tree roots. Therefore, every tree which does not bear good fruit is cut down and thrown into the fire.
speaker: Narrator

text: “I indeed baptize you with water to repentance, but He who is coming after me is mightier than I, whose shoes I am not worthy to carry. He will baptize you with the Holy Spirit and with fire.
speaker: Narrator

text: His fan is in His hand, and He will thoroughly clean His floor and gather His wheat into the granary, but He will burn up the chaff with unquenchable fire.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jesus came from Galilee to John at the Jordan to be baptized by him.
speaker: Narrator

text: But John prohibited Him, saying, “I need to be baptized by You, and do You come to me?”
speaker: Narrator

text: But Jesus answered him, “Let it be so now, for it is fitting for us to fulfill all righteousness.” Then he permitted Him.
speaker: Jesus

text: And when Jesus was baptized, He came up immediately out of the water. And suddenly the heavens were opened to Him, and He saw the Spirit of God descending on Him like a dove.
speaker: Narrator

text: And a voice came from heaven, saying, “This is My beloved Son, in whom I am well pleased.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jesus was led up into the wilderness by the Spirit to be tempted by the devil.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He had fasted for forty days and forty nights, and then He was hungry.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the tempter came to Him and said, “If You are the Son of God, command that these stones be turned into bread.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But He answered, “It is written, ‘Man shall not live by bread alone, but by every word that proceeds out of the mouth of God.’”
speaker: Jesus

text: Then the devil took Him up into the holy city, and set Him on the highest point of the temple,
speaker: Narrator

text:
and said to Him, “If You are the Son of God, throw Yourself down. For it is written,
    ‘He shall give His angels charge concerning you,’
and
    ‘In their hands they shall lift you up,
    lest at any time you dash your foot against a stone.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said to him, “It is also written, ‘You shall not tempt the Lord your God.’”
speaker: Jesus

text: Again, the devil took Him up on a very high mountain and showed Him all the kingdoms of the world and their grandeur,
speaker: Narrator

text: and said to Him, “All these things I will give You if You will fall down and worship me. ”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jesus said to him, “Get away from here, Satan! For it is written, ‘You shall worship the Lord your God, and Him only shall you serve.’ ”
speaker: Jesus

text: Then the devil left Him, and immediately angels came and ministered to Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now when Jesus heard that John was put in prison, He left for Galilee.
speaker: Narrator

text: And leaving Nazareth, He came and lived in Capernaum, which is by the sea, in the regions of Zebulun and Naphtali,
speaker: Narrator

text: that what was spoken by Isaiah the prophet might be fulfilled, saying:
speaker: Narrator

text:
“The land of Zebulun and the land of Naphtali,
    the way to the sea, beyond the Jordan,
    Galilee of the Gentiles:
speaker: Narrator

text:
The people who sat in darkness
    saw great light.
And on those who sat in the land of the shadow of death,
    light has dawned.”
speaker: Narrator

text: From that time Jesus began to preach, saying, “Repent! For the kingdom of heaven is at hand.”
speaker: Narrator

text: As Jesus walked beside the Sea of Galilee, He saw two brothers, Simon called Peter, and Andrew his brother, throwing a net into the sea, for they were fishermen.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He said to them, “Follow Me, and I will make you fishers of men.”
speaker: Narrator

text: They immediately left their nets and followed Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And going on from there, He saw two other brothers, James the son of Zebedee and John his brother, in a boat with Zebedee their father, mending their nets, and He called them.
speaker: Narrator

text: They immediately left the boat and their father and followed Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus went throughout all Galilee teaching in their synagogues, preaching the gospel of the kingdom, and healing all kinds of sickness and all sorts of diseases among the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: His fame went throughout all Syria. And they brought to Him all sick people who were taken with various diseases and tormented with pain, those who were possessed with demons, those who had seizures, and those who had paralysis, and He healed them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Great crowds followed Him from Galilee, the Decapolis, Jerusalem, Judea, and from beyond the Jordan.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now seeing the crowds, He went up on a mountain. And when He sat down, His disciples came to Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He began speaking and taught them, saying:
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Blessed are the poor in spirit,
    for theirs is the kingdom of heaven.
speaker: Jesus

text:
Blessed are those who mourn,
    for they shall be comforted.
speaker: Jesus

text:
Blessed are the meek,
    for they shall inherit the earth.
speaker: Jesus

text:
Blessed are those who hunger and thirst for righteousness,
    for they shall be filled.
speaker: Jesus

text:
Blessed are the merciful,
    for they shall obtain mercy.
speaker: Jesus

text:
Blessed are the pure in heart,
    for they shall see God.
speaker: Jesus

text:
Blessed are the peacemakers,
    for they shall be called the sons of God.
speaker: Jesus

text:
Blessed are those who are persecuted for righteousness’ sake,
    for theirs is the kingdom of heaven.
speaker: Jesus

text: “Blessed are you when men revile you, and persecute you, and say all kinds of evil against you falsely for My sake.
speaker: Jesus

text: Rejoice and be very glad, because great is your reward in heaven, for in this manner they persecuted the prophets who were before you.
speaker: Jesus

text: “You are the salt of the earth. But if the salt loses its saltiness, how shall it be made salty? It is from then on good for nothing but to be thrown out and to be trampled underfoot by men.
speaker: Jesus

text: “You are the light of the world. A city that is set on a hill cannot be hidden.
speaker: Jesus

text: Neither do men light a candle and put it under a basket, but on a candlestick. And it gives light to all who are in the house.
speaker: Jesus

text: Let your light so shine before men that they may see your good works and glorify your Father who is in heaven.
speaker: Jesus

text: “Do not think that I have come to abolish the Law or the Prophets. I have not come to abolish, but to fulfill.
speaker: Jesus

text: For truly I say to you, until heaven and earth pass away, not one dot or one mark will pass from the law until all be fulfilled.
speaker: Jesus

text: Whoever, therefore, breaks one of the least of these commandments and teaches others to do likewise shall be called the least in the kingdom of heaven. But whoever does and teaches them shall be called great in the kingdom of heaven.
speaker: Jesus

text: For I say to you that unless your righteousness exceeds the righteousness of the scribes and Pharisees, you will in no way enter the kingdom of heaven.
speaker: Jesus

text: “You have heard that it was said by the ancients, ‘You shall not murder,’ and ‘Whoever murders shall be in danger of the judgment.’
speaker: Jesus

text: But I say to you that whoever is angry with his brother without a cause shall be in danger of the judgment. And whoever says to his brother, ‘Raca,’ shall be in danger of the Sanhedrin. But whoever says, ‘You fool,’ shall be in danger of hell fire.
speaker: Jesus

text: “Therefore, if you bring your gift to the altar and there remember that your brother has something against you,
speaker: Jesus

text: leave your gift there before the altar and go on your way. First be reconciled to your brother, and then come and offer your gift.
speaker: Jesus

text: “Reconcile with your adversary quickly, while you are on the way with him, lest your adversary deliver you to the judge, and the judge deliver you to the officer, and you be thrown into prison.
speaker: Jesus

text: Truly I say to you, you will by no means come out of there until you have paid the last penny.
speaker: Jesus

text: “You have heard that it was said by the ancients, ‘You shall not commit adultery.’
speaker: Jesus

text: But I say to you that whoever looks on a woman to lust after her has committed adultery with her already in his heart.
speaker: Jesus

text: And if your right eye causes you to sin, pluck it out and throw it away. For it is profitable that one of your members should perish, and not that your whole body be thrown into hell.
speaker: Jesus

text: And if your right hand causes you to sin, cut it off and throw it away. For it is profitable for you that one of your members should perish, and not that your whole body be thrown into hell.
speaker: Jesus

text: “It was said, ‘Whoever divorces his wife, let him give her a certificate of divorce.’
speaker: Jesus

text: But I say to you that whoever divorces his wife, except for marital unfaithfulness, causes her to commit adultery. And whoever marries her who is divorced commits adultery.
speaker: Jesus

text: “Again, you have heard that it was said by the ancients, ‘You shall not swear falsely, but shall fulfill your oaths to the Lord.’
speaker: Jesus

text: But I say to you, do not swear at all: neither by heaven, for it is God’s throne;
speaker: Jesus

text: nor by the earth, for it is His footstool; nor by Jerusalem, for it is the city of the great King.
speaker: Jesus

text: Nor shall you swear by your head, because you cannot make one hair white or black.
speaker: Jesus

text: But let your ‘Yes’ mean ‘Yes,’ and ‘No’ mean ‘No.’ For whatever is more than these comes from the evil one.
speaker: Jesus

text: “You have heard that it was said, ‘An eye for an eye, and a tooth for a tooth.’
speaker: Jesus

text: But I say to you, do not resist an evil person. But whoever strikes you on your right cheek, turn to him the other as well.
speaker: Jesus

text: And if anyone sues you in a court of law and takes away your tunic, let him have your cloak also.
speaker: Jesus

text: And whoever compels you to go a mile, go with him two.
speaker: Jesus

text: Give to him who asks you, and from him who would borrow from you do not turn away.
speaker: Jesus

text: “You have heard that it was said, ‘You shall love your neighbor and hate your enemy.’
speaker: Jesus

text: But I say to you, love your enemies, bless those who curse you, do good to those who hate you, and pray for those who spitefully use you and persecute you,
speaker: Jesus

text: that you may be sons of your Father who is in heaven. For He makes His sun rise on the evil and on the good and sends rain on the just and on the unjust.
speaker: Jesus

text: For if you love those who love you, what reward do you have? Do not even the tax collectors do the same?
speaker: Jesus

text: And if you greet your brothers only, what are you doing more than others? Do not even the tax collectors do so?
speaker: Jesus

text: Therefore be perfect, even as your Father who is in heaven is perfect.
speaker: Jesus

text: “Be sure that you not do your charitable deeds before men to be seen by them. Otherwise you have no reward from your Father who is in heaven.
speaker: Jesus

text: “Therefore, when you do your charitable deeds, do not sound a trumpet before you as the hypocrites do in the synagogues and in the streets, that they may be honored by men. Truly I say to you, they have their reward.
speaker: Jesus

text: But when you do your charitable deeds, do not let your left hand know what your right hand is doing,
speaker: Jesus

text: that your charitable deeds may be in secret. And your Father who sees in secret will Himself reward you openly.
speaker: Jesus

text: “When you pray, you shall not be like the hypocrites. For they love to pray standing in the synagogues and on the street corners that they may be seen by men. Truly I say to you, they have their reward.
speaker: Jesus

text: But you, when you pray, enter your closet, and when you have shut your door, pray to your Father who is in secret. And your Father who sees in secret will reward you openly.
speaker: Jesus

text: But when you pray, do not use vain repetitions, as the heathen do. For they think that they will be heard for their much speaking.
speaker: Jesus

text: Do not be like them, for your Father knows what things you have need of before you ask Him.
speaker: Jesus

text:
“Therefore pray in this manner:
Our Father who is in heaven,
hallowed be Your name.
speaker: Jesus
Jesus

text: Give us this day our daily bread.
speaker: Jesus

text:
And forgive us our debts,
    as we forgive our debtors.
speaker: Jesus

text:
And lead us not into temptation,
    but deliver us from evil.
For Yours is the kingdom and the power and the glory forever. Amen.
speaker: Jesus

text: For if you forgive men for their sins, your heavenly Father will also forgive you.
speaker: Jesus

text: But if you do not forgive men for their sins, neither will your Father forgive your sins.
speaker: Jesus

text: “Moreover, when you fast, do not be like the hypocrites with a sad countenance. For they disfigure their faces so they may appear to men to be fasting. Truly I say to you, they have their reward.
speaker: Jesus

text: But you, when you fast, anoint your head and wash your face,
speaker: Jesus

text: so that you will not appear to men to be fasting, but to your Father who is in secret. And your Father who sees in secret will reward you openly.
speaker: Jesus

text: “Do not store up for yourselves treasures on earth where moth and rust destroy and where thieves break in and steal.
speaker: Jesus

text: But store up for yourselves treasures in heaven, where neither moth nor rust destroy and where thieves do not break in nor steal,
speaker: Jesus

text: for where your treasure is, there will your heart be also.
speaker: Jesus

text: “The light of the body is the eye. Therefore, if your eye is clear, your whole body will be full of light.
speaker: Jesus

text: But if your eye is unclear, your whole body will be full of darkness. Therefore, if the light that is in you is darkness, how great is that darkness!
speaker: Jesus

text: “No one can serve two masters. For either he will hate the one and love the other, or else he will hold to the one and despise the other. You cannot serve God and money.
speaker: Jesus

text: “Therefore, I say to you, take no thought about your life, what you will eat, or what you will drink, nor about your body, what you will put on. Is not life more than food and the body than clothing?
speaker: Jesus

text: Look at the birds of the air, for they do not sow, nor do they reap, nor gather into barns. Yet your heavenly Father feeds them. Are you not much better than they?
speaker: Jesus

text: Who among you by taking thought can add a cubit to his stature?
speaker: Jesus

text: “Why take thought about clothing? Consider the lilies of the field, how they grow: They neither work, nor do they spin.
speaker: Jesus

text: Yet I say to you that even Solomon in all his glory was not dressed like one of these.
speaker: Jesus

text: Therefore, if God so clothes the grass of the field, which today is here and tomorrow is thrown into the oven, will He not much more clothe you, O you of little faith?
speaker: Jesus

text: Therefore, take no thought, saying, ‘What shall we eat?’ or ‘What shall we drink?’ or ‘What shall we wear?’
speaker: Jesus

text: (For the Gentiles seek after all these things.) For your heavenly Father knows that you have need of all these things.
speaker: Jesus

text: But seek first the kingdom of God and His righteousness, and all these things shall be given to you.
speaker: Jesus

text: Therefore, take no thought about tomorrow, for tomorrow will take thought about the things of itself. Sufficient to the day is the trouble thereof.
speaker: Jesus

text: “Judge not, that you be not judged.
speaker: Jesus

text: For with what judgment you judge, you will be judged. And with the measure you use, it will be measured again for you.
speaker: Jesus

text: “And why do you see the speck that is in your brother’s eye, but do not consider the plank that is in your own eye?
speaker: Jesus

text: Or how will you say to your brother, ‘Let me pull the speck out of your eye,’ when a log is in your own eye?
speaker: Jesus

text: You hypocrite! First take the plank out of your own eye, and then you will see clearly to take the speck out of your brother’s eye.
speaker: Jesus

text: “Do not give what is holy to the dogs, nor throw your pearls before swine, lest they trample them under their feet and turn around and attack you.
speaker: Jesus

text: “Ask and it will be given to you; seek and you will find; knock and it will be opened to you.
speaker: Jesus

text: For everyone who asks receives, and he who seeks finds, and to him who knocks, it will be opened.
speaker: Jesus

text: “What man is there among you who, if his son asks for bread, will give him a stone?
speaker: Jesus

text: Or if he asks for a fish, will he give him a snake?
speaker: Jesus

text: If you then, being evil, know how to give good gifts to your children, how much more will your Father who is in heaven give good things to those who ask Him!
speaker: Jesus

text: Therefore, everything you would like men to do to you, do also to them, for this is the Law and the Prophets.
speaker: Jesus

text: “Enter at the narrow gate, for wide is the gate and broad is the way that leads to destruction, and there are many who are going through it,
speaker: Jesus

text: because small is the gate and narrow is the way which leads to life, and there are few who find it.
speaker: Jesus

text: “Beware of false prophets who come to you in sheep’s clothing, but inwardly they are ravenous wolves.
speaker: Jesus

text: You will know them by their fruit. Do men gather grapes from thorns, or figs from thistles?
speaker: Jesus

text: Even so, every good tree bears good fruit. But a corrupt tree bears evil fruit.
speaker: Jesus

text: A good tree cannot bear evil fruit, nor can a corrupt tree bear good fruit.
speaker: Jesus

text: Every tree that does not bear good fruit is cut down and thrown into the fire.
speaker: Jesus

text: Therefore, by their fruit you will know them.
speaker: Jesus

text: “Not everyone who says to Me, ‘Lord, Lord,’ shall enter the kingdom of heaven, but he who does the will of My Father who is in heaven.
speaker: Jesus

text: Many will say to Me on that day, ‘Lord, Lord, have we not prophesied in Your name, cast out demons in Your name, and done many wonderful works in Your name?’
speaker: Jesus

text: But then I will declare to them, ‘I never knew you. Depart from Me, you who practice evil.’
speaker: Jesus

text: “Whoever hears these sayings of Mine and does them, I will liken him to a wise man who built his house on a rock.
speaker: Jesus

text: And the rain descended, the floods came, and the winds blew and beat on that house. And it did not fall, for it was founded a rock.
speaker: Jesus

text: And every one who hears these sayings of Mine and does not do them will be likened to a foolish man who built his house on the sand.
speaker: Jesus

text: And the rain descended, the floods came, and the winds blew and beat on that house. And it fell. And its fall was great.”
speaker: Jesus

text: When Jesus finished these sayings, the people were astonished at His teaching,
speaker: Narrator

text: for He taught them as one having authority, and not as the scribes.
speaker: Narrator

text: When He came down from the mountains, large crowds followed Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And then a leper came and worshipped Him, saying, “Lord, if You are willing, You can make me clean.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus reached out His hand and touched him, saying, “I will. Be clean.” And immediately his leprosy was cleansed.
speaker: Jesus

text: Then Jesus said to him, “See that you tell no one. But go your way, show yourself to the priest, and offer the gift that Moses commanded as a testimony to them.”
speaker: Jesus

text: And when Jesus entered Capernaum, a centurion came to Him, entreating Him,
speaker: Narrator

text: and saying, “Lord, my servant is lying at home, sick with paralysis, terribly tormented.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said to him, “I will come and heal him.”
speaker: Jesus

text: The centurion answered and said, “Lord, I am not worthy that You should come under my roof. But speak the word only, and my servant will be healed.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I am a man under authority, having soldiers under me. And I say to this man, ‘Go,’ and he goes, and to another, ‘Come,’ and he comes, and to my servant, ‘Do this,’ and he does it.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When Jesus heard it, He was amazed and said to those who followed, “Truly I say to you, I have not found such great faith, no, not in Israel.
speaker: Jesus

text: And I say to you that many will come from the east and west and will dine with Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob in the kingdom of heaven.
speaker: Jesus

text: But the sons of the kingdom will be thrown out into outer darkness. There will be weeping and gnashing of teeth.”
speaker: Jesus

text: Then Jesus said to the centurion, “Go your way. And as you have believed, so let it be done for you.” And his servant was healed that very moment.
speaker: Jesus

text: When Jesus entered Peter’s house, He saw his wife’s mother, lying sick with a fever.
speaker: Narrator

text: He touched her hand, and the fever left her. And she rose and served them.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the evening came, they brought to Him many who were possessed with demons. And He cast out the spirits with His word, and healed all who were sick,
speaker: Narrator

text:
to fulfill what was spoken by Isaiah the prophet,
“He Himself took our infirmities
    and bore our sicknesses.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Now when Jesus saw large crowds around Him, He gave a command to depart to the other side.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then a certain scribe came and said to Him, “Teacher, I will follow You wherever You go.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus replied, “The foxes have holes and the birds of the air have nests, but the Son of Man has no place to lay His head.”
speaker: Jesus

text: Another of His other disciples said to Him, “Lord, let me first go and bury my father.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But Jesus said to him, “Follow Me, and let the dead bury their dead.”
speaker: Jesus

text: Then He entered the boat, and His disciples followed Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Suddenly a great storm arose on the sea, so that the boat was covered with the waves. But He was asleep.
speaker: Narrator

text: His disciples went to Him and awoke Him, saying, “Lord, save us! We are perishing!”
speaker: Narrator

text: He replied, “Why are you fearful, O you of little faith?” Then He rose and rebuked the winds and the sea. And there was a great calm.
speaker: Jesus

text: The men were amazed, saying, “What kind of Man is this that even the winds and the sea obey Him!”
speaker: Narrator

text: When He came to the other side into the country of the Gergesenes, there met Him two men possessed with demons, coming out of the tombs, extremely fierce, so that no one might pass by that way.
speaker: Narrator

text: Suddenly they cried out, saying, “What have we to do with You, Jesus, Son of God? Have You come here to torment us before the time?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Now a good way off from them was a herd of many swine feeding.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the demons begged Him, saying, “If You cast us out, permit us to go away into the herd of swine.”
speaker: Narrator

text: He said to them, “Go!” And when they came out, they went into the herd of swine. And suddenly the whole herd of swine ran violently down a steep place into the sea, and perished in the waters.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those who kept them fled, and went their ways into the city, and told everything, including what had happened to those possessed by the demons.
speaker: Narrator

text: The whole city came out to meet Jesus. And when they saw Him, they begged Him to depart out of their region.
speaker: Narrator

text: He entered a boat, crossed over, and came into His own city.
speaker: Narrator

text: They brought to Him a man sick with paralysis, lying on a bed. And Jesus, seeing their faith, said to the paralytic, “Son, be of good cheer. Your sins are forgiven you.”
speaker: Jesus

text: Then certain scribes said within themselves, “This Man blasphemes.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus, knowing their thoughts, said, “Why do you think evil in your hearts?
speaker: Jesus

text: For which is easier, to say, ‘Your sins are forgiven you’ or to say, ‘Arise and walk’?
speaker: Jesus

text: But that you may know that the Son of Man has authority on earth to forgive sins”—then He said to the paralytic, “Arise, pick up your bed, and go into your house.”
speaker: Jesus

text: And he rose and departed to his house.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when the crowds saw it, they were amazed and glorified God who had given such authority to men.
speaker: Narrator

text: As Jesus passed on from there, He saw a man named Matthew sitting at the tax collector’s station. And He said to him, “Follow Me.” And he rose and followed Him.
speaker: Jesus

text: While Jesus sat at supper in the house, many tax collectors and sinners came and sat down with Him and His disciples.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the Pharisees saw it, they said to His disciples, “Why does your Teacher eat with tax collectors and sinners?”
speaker: Narrator

text: But when Jesus heard that, He said to them, “Those who are well do not need a physician, but those who are sick.
speaker: Jesus

text: But go and learn what this means, ‘I desire mercy, and not sacrifice.’ For I have not come to call the righteous, but sinners, to repentance.”
speaker: Jesus

text: Then the disciples of John came to Him, asking, “Why do we and the Pharisees fast often, but Your disciples do not fast?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered, “Can the guests of the bridegroom mourn as long as the bridegroom is with them? But the days will come when the bridegroom will be taken from them, and then they will fast.
speaker: Jesus

text: “No one sews a piece of new cloth into an old garment, for that which is sewn in to fill it up pulls on the garment, and the tear is made worse.
speaker: Narrator

text: Neither do men put new wine into old wineskins. Or else the wineskins burst, the wine runs out, and the wineskins perish. But they put new wine into new wineskins, and both are preserved.”
speaker: Jesus

text: While He was speaking these things to them, a certain ruler came and worshipped Him, saying, “My daughter is even now dead. But come and lay Your hand on her, and she will live.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus rose and followed him, and so did His disciples.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then a woman, who was ill with a flow of blood for twelve years, came behind Him and touched the hem of His garment.
speaker: Narrator

text: For she said within herself, “If I may just touch His garment, I shall be healed.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But Jesus turned around, and when He saw her, He said, “Daughter, be of good comfort. Your faith has made you well.” And the woman was made well instantly.
speaker: Jesus

text: When Jesus came to the ruler’s house and saw the musicians and the mourners making a noise,
speaker: Narrator

text: He said to them, “Depart. The girl is not dead, but is sleeping.” And they laughed Him to scorn.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when the people were put outside, He went in and took her by the hand, and the girl arose.
speaker: Narrator

text: The news of this went out into all that land.
speaker: Narrator

text: As Jesus departed from there, two blind men followed Him, crying out and saying, “Son of David, have mercy on us!”
speaker: Narrator

text:
When He entered the house, the blind men came to Him. And Jesus said to them, “Do you believe that I am able to do this?”
They said to Him, “Yes, Lord.”
speaker: Jesus

text: Then He touched their eyes, saying, “According to your faith, let it be done for you.”
speaker: Jesus

text: And their eyes were opened, and Jesus strictly commanded them, saying, “See that no one knows of it.”
speaker: Jesus

text: But when they had departed, they spread His fame in all that region.
speaker: Narrator

text: As they went out, they brought to Him a mute man possessed with a demon.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when the demon was cast out, the mute man spoke, and the crowds were amazed, saying, “This has never been seen in Israel.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But the Pharisees said, “He casts out demons through the ruler of the demons.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus went throughout all the cities and villages, teaching in their synagogues, preaching the gospel of the kingdom, and healing every sickness and every disease among the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when He saw the crowds, He was moved with compassion for them, because they fainted and were scattered, like sheep without a shepherd.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then He said to His disciples, “The harvest truly is plentiful, but the laborers are few.
speaker: Jesus

text: Therefore, pray to the Lord of the harvest, that He will send out laborers into His harvest.”
speaker: Jesus

text: He called His twelve disciples to Him and gave them authority over unclean spirits, to cast them out, and to heal all kinds of sickness and all kinds of disease.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the names of the twelve apostles are these: first, Simon, who is called Peter, and Andrew, his brother; James, the son of Zebedee, and John, his brother;
speaker: Narrator

text: Philip and Bartholomew; Thomas, and Matthew, the tax collector; James, the son of Alphaeus; and Lebbaeus, whose surname was Thaddaeus;
speaker: Narrator

text: Simon the Zealot; and Judas Iscariot, who also betrayed Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: These twelve Jesus sent out, and commanded them, saying, “Do not go into the way of the Gentiles, and do not enter any city of the Samaritans.
speaker: Jesus

text: But go rather to the lost sheep of the house of Israel.
speaker: Jesus

text: As you go, preach, saying, ‘The kingdom of heaven is at hand.’
speaker: Jesus

text: Heal the sick, cleanse the lepers, raise the dead, and cast out demons. Freely you have received, freely give.
speaker: Jesus

text: “Provide neither gold nor silver nor copper for your purses,
speaker: Jesus

text: nor bag for your journey, nor two tunics, nor shoes, nor even staffs. For the workman is worthy of his keep.
speaker: Jesus

text: “In whatever city or town you enter, inquire in it who is worthy. And live there until you leave.
speaker: Jesus

text: When you come into a house, greet it.
speaker: Jesus

text: If the house is worthy, let your peace come upon it. But if it is not worthy, let your peace return to you.
speaker: Jesus

text: Whoever will not receive you, nor hear your words, when you depart out of that house or city, shake off the dust of your feet.
speaker: Jesus

text: Truly I say to you, it will be more tolerable for the land of Sodom and Gomorrah on the Day of Judgment than for that town.
speaker: Jesus

text: “Look, I am sending you out as sheep in the midst of wolves. Therefore be wise as serpents and harmless as doves.
speaker: Jesus

text: But beware of men, for they will deliver you up to the councils, and they will scourge you in their synagogues.
speaker: Jesus

text: You will be brought before governors and kings for My sake, for a testimony against them and the Gentiles.
speaker: Jesus

text: But when they deliver you up, take no thought of how or what you will speak. For it will be given you at that time what you will speak.
speaker: Jesus

text: For it is not you who speak, but the Spirit of your Father who speaks through you.
speaker: Jesus

text: “The brother will deliver up the brother to death, and the father the child. And the children will rise up against their parents and cause them to be put to death.
speaker: Jesus

text: You will be hated by all men for My name’s sake. But he who endures to the end will be saved.
speaker: Jesus

text: But when they persecute you in this city, escape into another. For truly I say to you, you will not have gone through the cities of Israel before the Son of Man comes.
speaker: Jesus

text: “The disciple is not above his teacher, nor the servant above his master.
speaker: Jesus

text: It is enough for the disciple that he be like his teacher, and the servant like his master. If they have called the master of the house Beelzebub, how much more will they call those of his household?
speaker: Jesus

text: “Therefore do not fear them. For nothing is covered that will not be revealed, or hidden that will not be known.
speaker: Jesus

text: What I tell you in darkness, speak in the light. And what you hear in the ear, preach on the housetops.
speaker: Jesus

text: Do not fear those who kill the body but are not able to kill the soul. But rather fear Him who is able to destroy both soul and body in hell.
speaker: Jesus

text: Are not two sparrows sold for a penny? And not one of them will fall to the ground without your Father.
speaker: Jesus

text: But the very hairs of your head are all numbered.
speaker: Jesus

text: Therefore do not fear. You are more valuable than many sparrows.
speaker: Jesus

text: “Whoever will confess Me before men, him will I confess also before My Father who is in heaven.
speaker: Jesus

text: But whoever will deny Me before men, him will I also deny before My Father who is in heaven.
speaker: Jesus

text: “Do not think that I have come to bring peace on earth. I did not come to bring peace, but a sword.
speaker: Jesus

text:
For I have come to turn
‘a man against his father,
    a daughter against her mother,
and a daughter-in-law against her mother-in-law;
speaker: Jesus

text: a man’s foes will be those of his own household.’
speaker: Jesus

text: “He who loves father or mother more than Me is not worthy of Me. And he who loves son or daughter more than Me is not worthy of Me.
speaker: Jesus

text: And He who does not take his cross and follow after Me is not worthy of Me.
speaker: Jesus

text: He who finds his life will lose it, and he who loses his life for My sake will find it.
speaker: Jesus

text: “He who receives you receives Me, and he who receives Me receives Him who sent Me.
speaker: Jesus

text: He who receives a prophet in the name of a prophet shall receive a prophet’s reward. And he who receives a righteous man in the name of a righteous man shall receive a righteous man’s reward.
speaker: Jesus

text: And whoever gives even a cup of cold water to one of these little ones in the name of a disciple, truly I tell you, he shall in no way lose his reward.”
speaker: Jesus

text: When Jesus finished instructing His twelve disciples, He departed from there to teach and to preach in their cities.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now when John had heard in prison the works of Christ, he sent two of his disciples,
speaker: Narrator

text: and said to Him, “Are You He who should come, or should we look for another?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered them, “Go and tell John what you hear and see:
speaker: Narrator

text: The blind receive their sight and the lame walk, the lepers are cleansed and the deaf hear, the dead are raised up, and the poor have the gospel preached to them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Blessed is he who does not fall away because of Me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: As they departed, Jesus began to say to the crowds concerning John, “What did you go out into the wilderness to see? A reed shaken by the wind?
speaker: Narrator

text: If not, what did you go out to see? A man dressed in soft clothing? Indeed, those who wear soft clothing are in kings’ houses.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then what did you go out to see? A prophet? Yes, I say to you, and more than a prophet.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For this is he of whom it is written:
‘Look, I am sending My messenger before Your face,
    who will prepare Your way before You.’
speaker: Narrator

text: Truly I say to you, among those who are born of women, there has risen no one greater than John the Baptist. But he who is least in the kingdom of heaven is greater than he.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the days of John the Baptist until now, the kingdom of heaven has forcefully advanced, and the strong take it by force.
speaker: Narrator

text: For all the Prophets and the Law prophesied until John.
speaker: Narrator

text: And if you are willing to receive it, he is Elijah, who is to come.
speaker: Narrator

text: He who has ears to hear, let him hear.
speaker: Narrator

text: “But to what shall I liken this generation? It is like children sitting in the markets, calling to their friends,
speaker: Narrator

text:
saying:
‘We played the flute for you,
    and you did not dance;
we sang a dirge to you,
    and you did not mourn.’
speaker: Narrator

text: For John came neither eating nor drinking, and they say, ‘He has a demon.’
speaker: Narrator

text: The Son of Man came eating and drinking, and they say, ‘Here is a gluttonous man, a drunkard, a friend of tax collectors and sinners.’ But wisdom is justified by her children.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then He began to reprimand the cities where most of His mighty works were done, because they did not repent:
speaker: Narrator

text: “Woe to you, Chorazin! Woe to you, Bethsaida! For if the mighty works which were done in you had been done in Tyre and Sidon, they would have repented long ago in sackcloth and ashes.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I say to you, it will be more tolerable for Tyre and Sidon on the Day of Judgment than for you.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you, Capernaum, who is exalted toward heaven, will be brought down to Hades. For if the mighty works which have been done in you had been done in Sodom, it would have remained until this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I say to you that it shall be more tolerable for the land of Sodom on the Day of Judgment than for you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: At that time Jesus said, “I thank You, O Father, Lord of heaven and earth, because You have hidden these things from the wise and prudent and revealed them to infants.
speaker: Narrator

text: Even so, Father, for it seemed good in Your sight.
speaker: Narrator

text: “All things are delivered to Me by My Father, and no one knows the Son, except the Father. And no one knows the Father, except the Son and he to whom the Son will reveal Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Come to Me, all you who labor and are heavily burdened, and I will give you rest.
speaker: Narrator

text: Take My yoke upon you, and learn from Me. For I am meek and lowly in heart, and you will find rest for your souls.
speaker: Narrator

text: For My yoke is easy, and My burden is light.”
speaker: Narrator

text: At that time Jesus went through the grain fields on the Sabbath. And His disciples were hungry and began to pluck the heads of grain and to eat.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when the Pharisees saw it, they said to Him, “Look, Your disciples are doing that which is not lawful to do on the Sabbath!”
speaker: Narrator

text: But He said to them, “Have you not read what David and those who were with him did when he was hungry,
speaker: Narrator

text: how he entered the house of God and ate the ritual bread, which was not lawful for him to eat, neither for those who were with him, but only for the priests?
speaker: Narrator

text: Or have you not read in the law how on the Sabbath the priests in the temple profane the Sabbath, but are blameless?
speaker: Narrator

text: I say to you, in this place there is One who is greater than the temple.
speaker: Narrator

text: If you had known what this meant, ‘I desire mercy, and not sacrifice,’ you would not have condemned the innocent.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Son of Man is Lord even of the Sabbath.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When He had departed from there, He went into their synagogue.
speaker: Narrator

text: And there was a man whose hand had withered. They asked Him, “Is it lawful to heal on the Sabbath?” that they might accuse Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: He said to them, “What man is there among you who has one sheep, and if it falls into a pit on the Sabbath, will not lay hold of it and lift it out?
speaker: Narrator

text: Then how much better is a man than a sheep? Therefore, it is lawful to do good on the Sabbath.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then He said to the man, “Stretch out your hand.” And he stretched it out, and it was restored whole like the other.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Pharisees went out and took counsel against Him, how they might kill Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when Jesus knew it, He withdrew from there. And great crowds followed Him, and He healed them all,
speaker: Narrator

text: and warned them that they should not make Him known,
speaker: Narrator

text: to fulfill what was spoken by Isaiah the prophet, saying:
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Here is My Servant, whom I have chosen,
    My Beloved, in whom My soul is well pleased;
I will put My Spirit upon Him,
    and He will render judgment to the Gentiles.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He shall not struggle nor cry out,
    nor will anyone hear His voice in the streets.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text: and in His name will the Gentiles trust.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then one possessed with a demon was brought to Him, blind and mute, and He healed him, so that the blind and mute man both spoke and saw.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the people were amazed and said, “Is He not the Son of David?”
speaker: Narrator

text: But when the Pharisees heard it, they said, “This Man does not cast out demons, except by Beelzebub the ruler of the demons.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus knew their thoughts and said to them, “Every kingdom divided against itself is brought to desolation. And every city or house divided against itself will not stand.
speaker: Narrator

text: If Satan casts out Satan, he is divided against himself. Then how will his kingdom stand?
speaker: Narrator

text: And if I cast out demons by Beelzebub, by whom do your sons cast them out? Therefore, they shall be your judges.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if I cast out demons by the Spirit of God, then the kingdom of God has come upon you.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Or else how can one enter a strong man’s house and plunder his goods unless he first binds the strong man? And then he will plunder his house.
speaker: Narrator

text: “He who is not with Me is against Me, and he who does not gather with Me scatters abroad.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore I say to you, all kinds of sin and blasphemy will be forgiven men, but the blasphemy against the Holy Spirit will not be forgiven men.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whoever speaks a word against the Son of Man will be forgiven. But whoever speaks against the Holy Spirit will not be forgiven, neither in this world, nor in the world to come.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Either make the tree good and its fruit good, or else make the tree corrupt and its fruit corrupt. For the tree is known by its fruit.
speaker: Narrator

text: O generation of vipers, how can you, being evil, speak good things? For out of the abundance of the heart the mouth speaks.
speaker: Narrator

text: A good man out of the good treasure of his heart brings forth good things. And an evil man out of the evil treasure brings forth evil things.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I say to you that for every idle word that men speak, they will give an account on the Day of Judgment.
speaker: Narrator

text: For by your words you will be justified, and by your words you will be condemned.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then some of the scribes and Pharisees said to Him, “Teacher, we wish to see a sign from You.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But He answered them, “An evil and adulterous generation seeks after a sign, and no sign will be given to it except the sign of the prophet Jonah.
speaker: Narrator

text: For as Jonah was three days and three nights in the belly of the great fish, so will the Son of Man be three days and three nights in the heart of the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: The men of Nineveh will stand up at the judgment with this generation and will condemn it, because they repented at the preaching of Jonah. And now One greater than Jonah is here.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Queen of the South will rise up at the judgment with this generation and will condemn it, for she came from the ends of the earth to hear the wisdom of Solomon. And now One greater than Solomon is here.
speaker: Narrator

text: “When an unclean spirit goes out of a man, it passes through dry places seeking rest, but finds none.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then it says, ‘I will return to my house from which I came.’ And when it comes, it finds it empty, swept, and put in order.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then it goes and brings with itself seven other spirits more evil than itself, and they enter and dwell there. And the last state of that man is worse than the first. So shall it be also with this evil generation.”
speaker: Narrator

text: While He was still speaking to the people, right then His mother and His brothers stood outside asking to speak with Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then one said to Him, “Look, Your mother and Your brothers are standing outside asking to speak with You.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But He answered the man who told him, “Who is My mother, and who are My brothers?”
speaker: Narrator

text: He stretched out His hand toward His disciples and said, “Here are My mother and My brothers!
speaker: Narrator

text: For whoever does the will of My Father who is in heaven is My brother, and sister, and mother.”
speaker: Narrator

text: That same day Jesus went out of the house and sat beside the sea.
speaker: Narrator

text: Great crowds assembled around Him, so that He went into a boat and sat there. And the whole assembly stood on the shore.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then He told them many things in parables, saying, “Listen! A sower went out to sow.
speaker: Narrator

text: While he sowed, some seeds fell beside the path, and the birds came and devoured them.
speaker: Narrator

text: But other seeds fell on rocky ground where they did not have much soil, and immediately they sprang up because they did not have deep soil.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when the sun rose, they were scorched. And because they did not take root, they withered away.
speaker: Narrator

text: Some seeds fell among thorns, and the thorns grew up and choked them.
speaker: Narrator

text: But other seeds fell into good ground and produced grain: a hundred, sixty, or thirty times as much.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whoever has ears to hear, let him hear.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The disciples came and said to Him, “Why do You speak to them in parables?”
speaker: Narrator

text: He answered them, “It is given to you to know the mysteries of the kingdom of heaven, but to them it is not given.
speaker: Narrator

text: For to him who has, will more be given, and he will have abundance. But from him who has not, even what he has will be taken away.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Therefore I speak to them in parables:
‘Because they look, but do not see.
    And they listen, but they do not hear, neither do they understand.’
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
for this people’s heart has grown dull.
    Their ears have become hard of hearing,
    and they have closed their eyes,
lest they should see with their eyes
    and hear with their ears
    and understand with their hearts,
and turn, and I should heal them.’
speaker: Narrator

text: But blessed are your eyes, for they see, and your ears, for they hear.
speaker: Narrator

text: For truly I say to you that many prophets and righteous men have desired to see those things which you see, and have not seen them, and to hear those things which you hear, and have not heard them.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Therefore listen to the parable of the sower.
speaker: Narrator

text: When anyone hears the word of the kingdom and does not understand it, the evil one comes and snatches away what was sown in his heart. This is the one who received seed beside the path.
speaker: Narrator

text: But he who received the seed on rocky ground is he who hears the word and immediately receives it with joy,
speaker: Narrator

text: yet he has no root in himself, but endures for a while. For when tribulation or persecution arises because of the word, eventually he falls away.
speaker: Narrator

text: He also who received seed among the thorns is he who hears the word, but the cares of this world and the deceitfulness of riches choke the word, and he becomes unfruitful.
speaker: Narrator

text: But he who received seed on the good ground is he who hears the word and understands it, who indeed bears fruit. Some produce a hundred, sixty, or thirty times what was sown.”
speaker: Narrator

text: He told them another parable, saying, “The kingdom of heaven is like a man who sowed good seed in his field.
speaker: Narrator

text: But while men slept, his enemy came and sowed weeds among the wheat and went away.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when the shoots had sprung up and produced fruit, the weeds also appeared.
speaker: Narrator

text: “So the servants of the landowner came and said to him, ‘Sir, did you not sow good seed in your field? Then where did the weeds come from?’
speaker: Narrator

text:
“He said to them, ‘An enemy did this.’
“The servants said to him, ‘Will you then have us go and gather them up?’
speaker: Narrator

text: “But he said, ‘No, lest while you gather up the weeds, you pull up also the wheat with them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let both grow together until the harvest, and in the time of harvest I will say to the reapers: Gather up the weeds first and bind them in bundles to burn them, but gather the wheat into my barn.’ ”
speaker: Narrator

text: He told them another parable, saying, “The kingdom of heaven is like a grain of mustard seed which a man took and sowed in his field.
speaker: Narrator

text: This indeed is the least of all seeds, but when it has grown, it is the greatest among herbs and is a tree, so that the birds of the air come and lodge in its branches.”
speaker: Narrator

text: He told them another parable: “The kingdom of heaven is like yeast which a woman took and mixed in sixty pounds of meal until it had leavened the whole batch.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said all these things to the crowds in parables. And without a parable He did not speak to them,
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text: Then Jesus sent the crowds away and went into the house. And His disciples came to Him, saying, “Explain to us the parable of the weeds of the field.”
speaker: Narrator

text: He answered, “He who sows the good seed is the Son of Man,
speaker: Narrator

text: the field is the world, and the good seed are the sons of the kingdom. But the weeds are the sons of the evil one.
speaker: Narrator

text: The enemy who sowed them is the devil, the harvest is the end of the world, and the reapers are the angels.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Therefore as the weeds are gathered and burned in the fire, so shall it be in the end of this world.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Son of Man shall send out His angels, and they shall gather out of His kingdom all things that offend, and those who do evil,
speaker: Narrator

text: and will throw them into a fiery furnace. There will be wailing and gnashing of teeth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the righteous will shine forth as the sun in the kingdom of their Father. Whoever has ears to hear, let him hear.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Again, the kingdom of heaven is like treasure hidden in a field, which a man found and hid. And with joy over it he goes and sells all that he has and buys that field.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Again, the kingdom of heaven is like a merchant seeking beautiful pearls,
speaker: Narrator

text: who, on finding one pearl of great price, went and sold all that he had and bought it.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Again, the kingdom of heaven is like a net that was cast into the sea and gathered all kinds of fish.
speaker: Narrator

text: When it was full, they drew it to shore, sat down, and gathered the good into baskets, but threw the bad away.
speaker: Narrator

text: So shall it be at the end of the world. The angels will come out and separate the evil from the righteous
speaker: Narrator

text: and throw them into the fiery furnace. There will be wailing and gnashing of teeth.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Jesus said to them, “Have you understood all of these things?”
They said to Him, “Yes, Lord.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then He said to them, “Therefore every scribe who is discipled for the kingdom of heaven is like a man who is master of the household who brings out of his treasure new and old things.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When Jesus finished these parables, He departed from there.
speaker: Narrator

text: When He came to His own country, He taught them in their synagogue, so that they were astonished, and said, “Where did this Man get this wisdom and these mighty works?
speaker: Narrator

text: Is He not the carpenter’s son? Is His mother not called Mary? And are not His brothers James and Joseph and Simon and Judas?
speaker: Narrator

text: And His sisters, are they not all with us? Where then did this Man get all these things?”
speaker: Narrator

text:
And they took offense at Him.
But Jesus said to them, “A prophet is not without honor except in his own country and in his own house.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And He did not do many mighty works there because of their unbelief.
speaker: Narrator

text: At that time Herod the tetrarch heard of the fame of Jesus,
speaker: Narrator

text: and said to his servants, “This is John the Baptist; he has risen from the dead. And therefore mighty works are at work in him.”
speaker: Narrator

text: For Herod had laid hold of John, bound him, and put him in prison for the sake of Herodias, his brother Philip’s wife.
speaker: Narrator

text: For John said to him, “It is not lawful for you to have her.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When Herod would have put him to death, he feared the crowd, because they counted him as a prophet.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when Herod’s birthday was celebrated, the daughter of Herodias danced before them and pleased Herod.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore he promised with an oath to give her whatever she would ask.
speaker: Narrator

text: Being previously instructed by her mother, she said, “Give me John the Baptist’s head on a platter.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The king was sorry. Nevertheless, for the oath’s sake and those who sat with him at supper, he commanded it to be given to her.
speaker: Narrator

text: He sent and beheaded John in the prison.
speaker: Narrator

text: His head was brought on a platter and given to the girl, and she brought it to her mother.
speaker: Narrator

text: His disciples came and took up the body and buried it. And they went and told Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Jesus heard this, He departed from there by boat for a deserted place. But when the people heard it, they followed Him on foot from the cities.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus went ashore and saw a great assembly. And He was moved with compassion toward them, and He healed their sick.
speaker: Narrator

text: When it was evening, His disciples came to Him, saying, “This is a lonely place and the day is now over. Send the crowds away to go into the villages and buy themselves food.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But Jesus said to them, “They do not need to depart. You give them something to eat.”
speaker: Narrator

text: They said to Him, “We have only five loaves here and two fish.”
speaker: Narrator

text: He said, “Bring them here to Me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then He commanded the crowds to sit down on the grass. He took the five loaves and the two fish, and looking up to heaven, He blessed and broke and gave the loaves to His disciples; and the disciples gave them to the crowds.
speaker: Narrator

text: They all ate and were filled. And they took up twelve baskets full of the fragments that remained.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those who had eaten were about five thousand men, besides women and children.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jesus commanded His disciples to get into the boat and go ahead of Him to the other side, while He sent the crowds away.
speaker: Narrator

text: When He sent the crowds away, He went up into a mountain by Himself to pray. And when evening came, He was there alone.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the boat was now in the middle of the sea, tossed by the waves, for the wind was turbulent.
speaker: Narrator

text: During the fourth watch of the night Jesus went to them, walking on the sea.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when the disciples saw Him walking on the sea, they were troubled, saying, “It is a spirit.” And they cried out in fear.
speaker: Narrator

text: But immediately Jesus spoke to them, saying, “Be of good cheer. It is I. Do not be afraid.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Peter answered Him and said, “Lord, if it is You, bid me come to You on the water.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
He said, “Come.”
And when Peter got out of the boat, he walked on the water to go to Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when he saw the strong wind, he was afraid, and beginning to sink, he cried out, “Lord, save me!”
speaker: Narrator

text: Immediately Jesus reached out His hand and caught him, and said to him, “O you of little faith, why did you doubt?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And when they got into the boat, the wind ceased.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then those who were in the boat came and worshipped Him, saying, “Truly You are the Son of God.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When they had crossed over, they came to the land of Gennesaret.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when the men of that place recognized Him, they sent word to all the surrounding country and brought to Him all who were sick,
speaker: Narrator

text: and begged Him that they might only touch the hem of His garment. And as many as touched it were made perfectly well.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then scribes and Pharisees who were from Jerusalem came to Jesus, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Why do Your disciples violate the tradition of the elders? For they do not wash their hands when they eat bread.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But He answered them, “Why do you also violate the commandment of God by your tradition?
speaker: Narrator

text: For God commanded, ‘Honor your father and mother,’ and, ‘He who speaks evil of father or mother, let him be put to death.’
speaker: Narrator

text: But you say, ‘Whoever shall say to his father or his mother, “What you would have profited from me is a gift to God,”
speaker: Narrator

text: will be free from honoring his father or his mother.’ So you have made the commandment of God of no effect by your tradition.
speaker: Narrator

text: You hypocrites, Isaiah well prophesied of you, saying:
speaker: Narrator

text:
‘These people draw near to Me with their mouth, and honor Me with their lips,
    but their heart is far from Me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
In vain they do worship Me,
    teaching as doctrines the precepts of men.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: He called the crowds and said to them, “Hear and understand:
speaker: Narrator

text: That which goes into the mouth does not defile a man, but that which comes out of the mouth, this defiles a man.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then His disciples came and said to Him, “Do You know that the Pharisees were offended after they heard this saying?”
speaker: Narrator

text: But He answered, “Every plant which My heavenly Father has not planted will be uprooted.
speaker: Narrator

text: Leave them alone. They are blind leaders of the blind. And if the blind lead the blind, both will fall into the ditch.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Peter said to Him, “Explain this parable to us.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said, “Are you also still without understanding?
speaker: Narrator

text: Do you not yet understand that whatever enters at the mouth goes into the stomach and is cast out into the sewer?
speaker: Narrator

text: But those things which proceed out of the mouth come from the heart, and they defile the man.
speaker: Narrator

text: For out of the heart proceed evil thoughts, murders, adulteries, sexual immorality, thefts, false witness, and blasphemies.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the things which defile a man. But to eat with unwashed hands does not defile a man.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jesus went from there and departed into the regions of Tyre and Sidon.
speaker: Narrator

text: There, a woman of Canaan came out of the same regions and cried out to Him, saying, “Have mercy on me, O Lord, Son of David. My daughter is severely possessed by a demon.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But He did not answer her a word. And His disciples came and begged Him, saying, “Send her away, for she cries out after us.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But He answered, “I was sent only to the lost sheep of the house of Israel.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then she came and worshipped Him, saying, “Lord, help me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But He answered, “It is not fair to take the children’s bread and to throw it to dogs.”
speaker: Narrator

text: She said, “Yes, Lord, yet even dogs eat the crumbs that fall from their masters’ table.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jesus answered her, “O woman, great is your faith. Let it be done for you as you desire.” And her daughter was healed instantly.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus departed from there, and passed by the Sea of Galilee, and went up on a mountain and sat down there.
speaker: Narrator

text: Great crowds came to Him, having with them those who were lame, blind, mute, maimed, and many others, and placed them down at Jesus’ feet, and He healed them,
speaker: Narrator

text: so that the crowds wondered when they saw the mute speak, the maimed made whole, the lame walk, and the blind see. And they glorified the God of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jesus called His disciples to Him and said, “I have compassion on the crowd, because they have remained with Me now for three days and have nothing to eat. I will not send them away hungry, lest they faint on the way.”
speaker: Narrator

text: His disciples said to Him, “Where will we get enough bread in the wilderness to feed such a great crowd?”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Jesus said to them, “How many loaves do you have?”
And they said, “Seven and a few little fish.”
speaker: Narrator

text: He commanded the crowd to sit down on the ground.
speaker: Narrator

text: He took the seven loaves and the fish, gave thanks, broke them, and gave them to His disciples, and the disciples gave them to the crowd.
speaker: Narrator

text: They all ate and were filled. And they collected seven baskets full of the broken pieces that were left.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those who ate were four thousand men, besides women and children.
speaker: Narrator

text: He sent the crowd away, and got into the boat, and went to the region of Magdala.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Pharisees and Sadducees came and, testing Him, asked Him to show them a sign from heaven.
speaker: Narrator

text: He answered them, “When it is evening, you say, ‘It will be fair weather, for the sky is red,’
speaker: Narrator

text: and in the morning, ‘It will be foul weather today, for the sky is red and overcast.’ O you hypocrites, you can discern the face of the sky, but you cannot discern the signs of the times.
speaker: Narrator

text: A wicked and adulterous generation seeks for a sign, but no sign shall be given to it except the sign of the prophet Jonah.” So He left them and departed.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when His disciples reached the other side, they had forgotten to take bread.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jesus said to them, “Take heed and beware of the yeast of the Pharisees and Sadducees.”
speaker: Narrator

text: They reasoned among themselves, saying, “It is because we have taken no bread.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But when Jesus perceived it, He said to them, “O you of little faith, why reason among yourselves, that it is because you have brought no bread?
speaker: Narrator

text: Do you not yet understand or remember the five loaves of the five thousand and how many baskets you collected?
speaker: Narrator

text: Or the seven loaves of the four thousand and how many baskets you collected?
speaker: Narrator

text: How is it that you do not understand that I spoke to you not concerning bread, but that you should beware of the yeast of the Pharisees and Sadducees?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they understood that He did not tell them to beware of the yeast of bread, but of the teaching of the Pharisees and Sadducees.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Jesus came into the region of Caesarea Philippi, He asked His disciples, “Who do men say that I, the Son of Man, am?”
speaker: Narrator

text: They said, “Some say that You are John the Baptist, others say Elijah, and others Jeremiah or one of the prophets.”
speaker: Narrator

text: He said to them, “But who do you say that I am?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Simon Peter replied, “You are the Christ, the Son of the living God.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered him, “Blessed are you, Simon son of Jonah, for flesh and blood has not revealed this to you, but My Father who is in heaven.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I tell you that you are Peter, and on this rock I will build My church, and the gates of Hades shall not prevail against it.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will give you the keys of the kingdom of heaven, and whatever you bind on earth shall be bound in heaven, and whatever you loose on earth shall be loosed in heaven.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then He commanded His disciples to tell no one that He was Jesus the Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: From that time on, Jesus began to show His disciples that He must go to Jerusalem and suffer many things from the elders and chief priests and scribes, and be killed, and be raised on the third day.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Peter took Him and began rebuking Him, saying, “Far be it from You, Lord! This shall not happen to You.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But He turned and said to Peter, “Get behind Me, Satan! You are an offense to Me, for you are not mindful of the things that are of God, but those that are of men.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jesus said to His disciples, “If anyone will come after Me, let him deny himself, and take up his cross, and follow Me.
speaker: Narrator

text: For whoever would save his life will lose it, and whoever loses his life for My sake will find it.
speaker: Narrator

text: For what will it profit a man if he gains the whole world and loses his own soul? Or what shall a man give in exchange for his soul?
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Son of Man shall come with His angels in the glory of His Father, and then He will repay every man according to his works.
speaker: Narrator

text: Truly I say to you, there are some standing here who shall not taste death before they see the Son of Man coming in His kingdom.”
speaker: Narrator

text: After six days Jesus took Peter, James, and John his brother and brought them up to a high mountain alone,
speaker: Narrator

text: and was transfigured before them. His face shone as the sun, and His garments became white as the light.
speaker: Narrator

text: Suddenly Moses and Elijah appeared to them, talking with Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Peter said to Jesus, “Lord, it is good for us to be here. If You wish, let us make three tabernacles here: one for You, one for Moses, and one for Elijah.”
speaker: Narrator

text: While he was still speaking, suddenly a bright cloud overshadowed them, and a voice from the cloud said, “This is My beloved Son, with whom I am well pleased. Listen to Him.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When the disciples heard this, they fell on their faces and were filled with awe.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Jesus came and touched them and said, “Rise, and do not be afraid.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When they lifted up their eyes, they saw no one but Jesus only.
speaker: Narrator

text: As they came down the mountain, Jesus commanded them, “Tell the vision to no one until the Son of Man is risen from the dead.”
speaker: Narrator

text: His disciples asked Him, “Why then do the scribes say that Elijah must come first?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered, “Elijah truly does first come and will restore all things.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I tell you that Elijah has already come, and they did not know him, but did to him whatever they pleased. Likewise, the Son of Man will also suffer at their hands.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the disciples understood that He was speaking to them of John the Baptist.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they came to the crowd, a man came to Him and knelt before Him, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Lord, have mercy on my son, for he is an epileptic and suffers terribly. He often falls into the fire and often into the water.
speaker: Narrator

text: I brought him to Your disciples, but they could not heal him.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jesus answered, “O faithless and perverse generation, how long shall I be with you? How long shall I bear with you? Bring him here to Me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus rebuked the demon, and he came out of him. And the child was healed instantly.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the disciples came to Jesus privately and said, “Why could we not cast him out?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said to them, “Because of your unbelief. For truly I say to you, if you have faith as a grain of mustard seed, you will say to this mountain, ‘Move from here to there,’ and it will move. And nothing will be impossible for you.
speaker: Narrator

text: But this kind does not go out except by prayer and fasting.”
speaker: Narrator

text: While they were staying in Galilee, Jesus said to them, “The Son of Man is about to be betrayed into the hands of men,
speaker: Narrator

text: and they will kill Him, and He will be raised on the third day.” And they were extremely sorrowful.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they came to Capernaum, those who collected tax money came to Peter and said, “Does your Teacher not pay the tax?”
speaker: Narrator

text:
He said, “Yes.”
And when he came home, Jesus stopped him, saying, “What do you think, Simon? From whom do the kings of the earth take custom or taxes? From their own sons or from strangers?”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Peter said to Him, “From strangers.”
Jesus said to him, “Then the sons are free.
speaker: Narrator

text: However, lest we offend them, go to the sea and cast a hook, and take the first fish that comes up. And when you open its mouth, you will find a coin. Take it and give it to them for you and Me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: At that time the disciples came to Jesus, saying, “Who is the greatest in the kingdom of heaven?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus called a little child to Him and set him in their midst,
speaker: Narrator

text: and said, “Truly I say to you, unless you are converted and become like little children, you will not enter the kingdom of heaven.
speaker: Narrator
